itemdesc-creature-bandit-knife: Footpads roam the hills and valleys at night, preying on unsuspecting travelers.
deadcreature-eaten-banditknife:
Slain by human hands.
They were stabbed with a knife.
itemdesc-creature-bandit-axe: Brigands are outlawed men, desperate for coin. Beware as they waylay along the roads at night.
deadcreature-eaten-banditaxe:
Slain by human hands.
They were hacked appart with an axe.
itemdesc-creature-bandit-spear: Brigands are outlawed men, desperate for coin. Beware as they waylay along the roads at night.
deadcreature-eaten-banditspear:
Slain by human hands.
They were been run-through with a spear.
itemdesc-creature-looter: Looters are desperate and dangerous. Beware as they waylay along the roads at night.
deadcreature-eaten-looter:
Slain by human hands.
They were clubbed to death.
itemdesc-creature-poacher-spear: Poachers hunt the woodlands illegally. The punishment for their crimes are severe, so they don't tend to stick around unless they have no other choice.
deadcreature-eaten-poacherspear:
Slain by human hands.
They were run through by a poacher's spear.
itemdesc-creature-poacher-archer: Poachers hunt the woodlands illegally. The punishment for their crimes are severe, so they don't tend to stick around unless they have no other choice.
deadcreature-eaten-poacherarcher:
Slain by human hands.
They were shot with a poacher's arrow.
itemdesc-creature-yeoman-archer: Yeoman are free farmers. Sometimes, when the crops fail, they have to turn to other means to make ends-meet.
deadcreature-eaten-yeomanarcher:
Slain by human hands.
They were shot with an arrow.
itemdesc-creature-hound-feral: Feral hounds have no owner to bring them to heel. They roam the lands in packs, attacking weak prey for easy meals.
deadcreature-eaten-houndferal: They've been mauled by a hound.
itemdesc-creature-hound-hunting: Hunting hounds are the loyal companions of huntsmen the world over. They will risk their lives to protect their owners.
deadcreature-eaten-houndhunting: They've been mauled by a hound.

blockdesc-stocks-*:
Let them rot in the pillory. Pelt them with stones, fruit, and filth. They'll have plenty of time to think about what they've done.

Outlaws won't dare appear within 35 blocks of this symbol of justice.
blockdesc-headonspear-looter-*:
What a grisly sight.

Outlaws won't dare appear within 15 blocks of this terrifying symbol of justice.
blockdesc-headonspear-poacher-*:
His hunting days are done.

Outlaws won't dare appear within 20 blocks of this terrifying symbol of justice.
blockdesc-headonspear-brigand-*:
He lived by the sword, so he died by the sword.

Outlaws won't dare appear within 25 blocks of this terrifying symbol of justice.
blockdesc-headonspear-yeoman-*:
His bow shall sing no more.

Outlaws won't dare appear within 25 blocks of this terrifying symbol of justice.
itemdesc-outlawhead-looter: He though looting would get him ahead in life...
itemdesc-outlawhead-brigand: Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio. A fellow of infinite jest...
stocks-handbook-help-text: Pillories are a basic tool of medieval justice. They deter crime through public humiliation. Building a pillary shows the Outlaws you mean buisness. Outlaws will not spawn within 35 blocks of a pillary.
headonspear-looter-handbook-help-text:
Placing Outlaw heads on spears and displaying them in your territory sends a clear message to other would-be criminals: Stay away or suffer the same fate. It's a grisly but effective tactic. The tougher the Outlaw whose head you display, the greater the effect.

A Looter head on a spear will block Outlaw spawns in a 15 block radius.
headonspear-poacher-handbook-help-text:
Placing Outlaw heads on spears and displaying them in your territory sends a clear message to other would-be criminals: Stay away or suffer the same fate. It's a grisly but effective tactic. The tougher the Outlaw whose head you display, the greater the effect.

A Poacher head on a spear will block Outlaw spawns in a 20 block radius.
headonspear-brigand-handbook-help-text:
Placing Outlaw heads on spears and displaying them in your territory sends a clear message to other would-be criminals: Stay away or suffer the same fate. It's a grisly but effective tactic. The tougher the Outlaw whose head you display, the greater the effect.

A Brigand head on a spear will block Outlaw spawns in a 25 block radius.
headonspear-yeoman-handbook-help-text:
Placing Outlaw heads on spears and displaying them in your territory sends a clear message to other would-be criminals: Stay away or suffer the same fate. It's a grisly but effective tactic. The tougher the Outlaw whose head you display, the greater the effect.

A Yeoman head on a spear will block Outlaw spawns in a 25 block radius.
gamemechanicinfo-outlaws-text:
Who are they?
Outlaws are individuals who have commited crimes, and having refused to stand trial, have been branded as outside the protection of the law, or Outlawed. An Outlaw's life is forfit, anyone can kill them suffer no legal repercussions, in fact, it's considered a public service. So where do such desperate individuals go? Outlaws can be found throughout the world, in virtually all climates. However, they prefer rural and densely forested regions where they can easily hide. They perfer to travel and work at night, when they can easily ambush unsuspecting travelers.

Detering Outlaws
Outlaws can be detered from incuring into your territory by building and displaying instuments of justice such as the Pillory and Heads On Spears. These frigtening symbols of justice will keep all but the most bold Outlaws at bay.
